com::xuggle::ferry::JNIHelper

com::xuggle::ferry::JNIHelper Class Reference

#include <JNIHelper.h>

Collaboration diagram for com::xuggle::ferry::JNIHelper:

[legend]

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The JNIHelper object contains a series of methods designed to assist functions when running inside a Java JVM.

There is only one JNIHelper object per shared library loaded.

Definition at line 37 of file JNIHelper.h.

void com::xuggle::ferry::JNIHelper::throwOutOfMemoryError (  ) 

Be VERY careful in this function; it gets call when we're low on memory so you check any allocations of memory, as they are incredibly likely to fail -- and will do so on the most inconvenient OS more often than others.

Definition at line 507 of file JNIHelper.cpp.

References getEnv().

00508   {
00515     JNIEnv *env = this->getEnv();
00516     if (!env)
00517       return;
00518     // exception already pending?
00519     if (env->ExceptionCheck())
00520       return;
00521     jclass cls=0;
00522 
00523     // let's set up a singleton out of memory error for potential
00524     // reuse later
00525     cls = env->FindClass("java/lang/OutOfMemoryError");
00526     // couldn't find the class?
00527     if (cls) {
00528       int retval = env->ThrowNew(cls, "out of native memory");
00529       env->DeleteLocalRef(cls);
00530       if (retval == 0) // success
00531         return;
00532     }
00533       
00534     if (!mOutOfMemoryErrorSingleton)
00535       return;
00536     env->Throw(mOutOfMemoryErrorSingleton);
00537   }

int32_t com::xuggle::ferry::JNIHelper::isInterrupted (  ) 

Definition at line 540 of file JNIHelper.cpp.

References getEnv().

00541   {
00542     JNIEnv * env = this->getEnv();
00543     if (!env)
00544       return 0;
00545     if (env->ExceptionCheck())
00546       return 1; // a pending exception interrupts us
00547     if (!mThread_class ||
00548         !mThread_isInterrupted_mid ||
00549         !mThread_currentThread_mid)
00550       // this is an error if these are not set up, but we're
00551       // going to assume no interrupt then.
00552       return 0;
00553     
00554     jclass cls = static_cast<jclass>(env->NewLocalRef(mThread_class));
00555     if (!cls)
00556       return 0;
00557     
00558     jobject thread = env->CallStaticObjectMethod(
00559         cls,
00560         mThread_currentThread_mid);
00561     env->DeleteLocalRef(cls);
00562     if (!thread || env->ExceptionCheck())
00563       return 1;
00564     jboolean result = env->CallBooleanMethod(thread,
00565         mThread_isInterrupted_mid);
00566     env->DeleteLocalRef(thread);
00567     if (env->ExceptionCheck())
00568       result = false;
00569     if (result != JNI_FALSE)
00570       return 1;
00571     return 0; 
00572   }

00612       return false; // a pending exception interrupts us
